projectGridLines.title: Bamboo Project Implementation /Market entry strategy for Bamboo handicraft products
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Ekibeki intends to enter into Bamboo handicraft products. A broad strategy has been created. We expect the student to work on fine tuning it and implementing it. Details attached.

Skill sets: Analytical Skills, Initiative and Communication Skills

Traits expectation: Hard working, self starter, passionate

Expected learning: Building a new business from the ground up

Specific courses required for project execution:  Nothing in particular. If they have studied a bit of business or entrepreneurship that is a bonus

Objective: Creating a strategy and business plan for bamboo handicraft products. Articulating a bold and ambitious vision for Bamboo â€“ for the next 5 years.


Key Activities: 


  1. Raw Material & Artisanal Cluster Analysis
  2. Identifying the specific bamboo species suited for handicrafts and the regions in India where the required bamboo varieties are abundantly available for viable production. 
  3. Evaluate & choose a suitable artisanal production cluster with the relevant experience and knowledge to build & grow.


  1. Market Building
  2. Study existing bamboo-based businesses in India and abroad. Understand their strengths, weaknesses, product and market positioning.
  3. Identifying the target products to manufacture basis its market volume and value, including both domestic and international markets. 


  1. Design and Prototyping
  2. Evaluate what types of bamboo products fit with artisan-centric model. 
  3. Developing prototypes to run small-scale tests to ensure the feasibility and market appeal of products.


  1. Production and Manufacturing
  2. Research various treatment methods and identifying the types of machinery, costs, and labour required for processing bamboo into the desired form.
  3. Map out the production process from raw bamboo to the final product, detailing artisanal labour requirements, process time, and energy use.
  4. Develop quality control standards for bamboo products. Include testing for durability, finish, and design precision. 


  1. Distribution and Logistics
  2. Identify potential distribution channels for bamboo products and planning out the logistics for transporting raw materials and finished products. 
  3. Determine warehousing facilities for storing raw materials and finished products.

  5. Marketing and Sales
  6. Define how to position bamboo products in the market and develop marketing content around these themes.
  7. Explore partnerships with organizations that promote eco-friendly and sustainable products, or with other companies in the bamboo ecosystem to build brand awareness and attract customers.
  8. Develop a pricing strategy based on production costs, market demand, and competition and plan how you will sell the products.


  1. Legal and Regulatory Compliance
  2. Research on government policies or regulations regarding bamboo cultivation, production, and trade, both domestically and internationally.
  3. Building the necessary certifications (like FSC certification for sustainable sourcing) for both domestic and international markets.


  1. Finance and Economics
  2. Outline the entire cost structure, from raw material procurement to processing, production, marketing, and distribution.
  3. Identify revenue streams, including direct sales, export opportunities, and potential collaborations or B2B sales.
  4. Perform a break-even analysis to project profitability over different time horizons
  5. Identify potential sources of funding or investment for scaling up.

  7. Sustainability and Impact
  8. Assess how the business will contribute to sustainability and a positive environmental footprint.
  9. Detail how expanding into bamboo products will positively affect the community
  10. Ensure ethical production practices and fair compensation for artisans.
